Key Match Events: The Cardinals came away with a 14-7 win.
Yankees' relievers allowed nine runs (eight earned), including five in the top of the seventh when the game had been tied at 7.
Victor Scott II doubled over the head of right fielder Juan Soto to bring home Nootbaar.
Phil Bickford threw the ball past first baseman Anthony Rizzo, allowing Scott to score.
Luken Baker hit a two-run homer in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Nestor Cortes said, 'As bad as people think we are playing … we are still in first place. It’s there for us to take. We just have to come out every day prepared and be ready to win every single day.'

Yankees manager Aaron Boone said, 'The difference is, we couldn’t close out that inning. We were still tied with two outs when they got all of those five runs. It’s one of those games. Tommy has been so good. Cousins has been so good. So no issues going right back to those guys, and knowing how important they have been to our bullpen and our success on the back end.'

Tommy Kahnle said, 'I got behind a couple of counts. I made some bad pitches. They adjusted and took advantage. … The changeup was over the plate a couple of times. A couple of heaters were hit pretty hard. … Obviously, I want to go out and do well, and it didn’t go well for me. Hopefully, I can rebound from this.'

Aaron Boone said, 'We know how important these games are. Another opportunity to win a series that we weren’t able to finish and that sucks, but it’s onward. … We have to play our best, and we have to put our best foot forward to win these games. And we hope we start that tomorrow night.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain affected the game, causing Alex Verdugo to slow down on a fly ball hit down the left-field line by Masyn Winn, resulting in a two-run double.
